messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Praising our kids!
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 6/6/2003 7:36:33 PM Eastern Daylight Time, ... Maybe she just thought you were too indulgent to be a mother.  Most moms (well not most but
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 6/6/2003 7:36:33 PM Eastern Daylight Time,
starsuncloud@... writes:

> The lady was laughing and she asked "are they YOUR kids?"
> When I said they were, she got this funny look on her face, like she
> couldn't
> quite believe it. I guess a Mom that said yes and had fun was just too much
> for her???
>
> Ren
>

Maybe she just thought you were too indulgent to be a mother. Most moms
(well not most but many) would either do the choosing for the kids, or LIMIT the
choosing or number of donuts, because maybe too much sugar, too messy, spoil
the appetite for lunch, for all those "motherly" reasons that sometimes just
spill out of the mouths of mothers who are trying so hard to be mothers they
sometimes forget what it's like to be the child.

BTW, we LOVE the krispy kreme here and it's such great fun to drive to
Alexandria in the middle of the night to get donuts on a whim and watch through the
glass outside and see them being made. Lots of fun to see all the different
types of people at the Krispy Kreme in the middle of the night too.

Big adventure, sometimes we even wake up the little kid next door to go, he
seems way less impressed than my own do though...

glena



[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Praising our kids!
messages.messageBody:
starsuncloud@... writes:

<< The lady was laughing and she asked "are they YOUR kids?"
When I said they were, she got this funny look on her face, like she
couldn't
quite believe it. I guess a Mom that said yes and had fun was just too much
for her???

Ren
>>

Man, I don't know whether to laugh or cry at that. Do people really believe
you can only do that with other people's children, and not your own? Btw, I
have a lot of fun with cousins and nieces and nephews, too, but *sigh*.....

~Aimee

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Praising our kids!
messages.messageBody:
From: <starsuncloud@...>

<<The lady was laughing and she asked "are they YOUR kids?"
When I said they were, she got this funny look on her face, like she
couldn't
quite believe it. I guess a Mom that said yes and had fun was just too much
for her???>>


Think of it another way Ren. Maybe you just don't look like a mom! Take that
as a compliment!!

Mary B

messages.subject: Praising our kids!
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 6/6/2003 5:25:19 PM Central Daylight Time, ... We went to Krispy Kreme last Sunday, after church. It was just Jared, Sierra and I. We were
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 6/6/2003 5:25:19 PM Central Daylight Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:
> Well, except maybe that one time in the grocery store when we were having
>
> so much fun, and everyone glared at us, because, dammit, don't we know that
> grocery shopping is supposed to be a boring chore? Nope. And I don't care
> what other people think it's "supposed" to be. Seeing a parent and child
> together having fun doing the shopping was probably quite a shock, as I
> never see
> it, either.

We went to Krispy Kreme last Sunday, after church. It was just Jared, Sierra
and I. We were having so much fun trying to pick which donuts, "oooh, oooh,
look at these ones with sprinkles" or "HEY, this has cream filling!" abd every
kind of donut they picked I asked for two of.
The lady was laughing and she asked "are they YOUR kids?"
When I said they were, she got this funny look on her face, like she couldn't
quite believe it. I guess a Mom that said yes and had fun was just too much
for her???

Ren


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
